intro: Lithoxylon lindleyi, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern South America. It is a small tree or shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, fig-like fruits. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Lithoxylon lindleyi plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food for various wildlife species.
